Reviews.Title: “March 2012 stay - absolutely fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Ben E
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend went to the hotel in March 2012 for her Birthday and I cannot stress enough how good the hotel is. It's a typical Parisian hotel with small rooms but the location and service you can't beat. Our first impression was the gent on reception knowing who we were before I even opened my mouth as we were the last to check in. Their English is fantastic and everybody at the hotel cannot help you enough, even down to recommending places to eat locally. The location is perfect, the Eiffel tower is a 5 minute walk and the Champs Elysees is a 3 minute walk. PERFECT

Reviews.Title: “Great character; fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CastawayKnight
Reviews.Content: This really is a delightfully individualistic hotel in one of the most desirable Paris locations - just a few minutes walk in either direction to either the Arc de Triomphe or the River Seine. The hotel is typically small, but it is clean and contemporary in its design and is fully air-conditioned and has free wi-fi. All the other conveniences such as room safe, minibar and hairdryer are also present. Service is friendly, professional and efficient. I will certainly choose this hotel again the next time I need to be in this part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience in years...”
Reviews.Author: shahrokh s
Reviews.Content: Superbe Service: What makes this hotel the best I have stayed at (I travel abroad at least twice a months) is the unbeatable service. I arrived at 11 am and had to attend a meeting in a rush instead of the usual - our rooms are not ready- they prepared one for me in record time. Every question or issue I had was addressed with speed and efficteveness. Adonis, the reception manager goes out of his way to help and solve any issue you have. Great Location: less than 5 minutes from champs Elysees and less than 3 minutes to subway. Elegant Rooms: rooms are above standard for the price and city. I have stayed in at least 10 boutique hotels in Paris. Never really satisfied. This one had a coozy stylish room. Small like all hotel rooms in Paris but large enough to feel comfortable. I will definitely stay there again. I highly recommend it. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Small, but stylish rooms in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: Larklight
Reviews.Content: Pros: Good location - many of the sights are walkable and there seem to be excellent nearby transport links (e.g. At least 3 metro stations in easy reach and on a direct line to the louvre and near montmatre. Easy to get to Gare du Nord and the Air France bus (which is open to all regardless of airline) from Charles de Gaulle stops at the Arc de Triomphe 5 min walk away). Stylish decor in room. 24 hour reception (note you need to hand key in whenever you leave the building). Nice bathroom (shower not bath). Reception staff speak English. Safe in room. Balcony (5th floor). Cons: Small room (and short bed?), although good use made of space (we were in a standard room). Limited control over heating etc (was rather too warn for us). Building work next to our room (which we weren't told about when booking or when checking in, although was not too disruptive apart from workmen in morning).

Reviews.Title: “Liars..cowards.. Do not stay...”
Reviews.Author: shari610
Reviews.Content: After having a problem with the same reason at another hotel in Paris and crying my eyes on Christmas , I call this hotel and explain my situation. I was on a waiting list at four seasons , so wanted what I co,d get for such short notice. The receptionist seemed sympathetic and guaranteed me that my room would be as the picture I saw in bourchre , and room was on the larger size. I explained my husband was over 6' foot and I needed space with windows that opened and a nice size bath. He said out oui.. I said are you sure you understand me, he " yes, Madame, absolutely., I just finished reading your email, and he was laughing. I thought that was a bit rude , but I let it slide.he asked for the credit card. I asked him how much and he confirmed in euros and American dollars. At this pont, I was locked in.. When we arrived, we saw a sweet young lady and she gave us our key, the elevator was tiny, bad sign, when we got to the room I thought I would die . We're they kidding me. It was smaller than the hotel I just checked out of, was this a bad joke. No window that opened, it was sealed shut, no tub, actually no real bathroom, it had like salon doors, no privacy, no shower doors, lke half a glass wall,had to stand side ways to fit in bathroom and I am a small woman, bed was tiny, no way my husbands 6'1 frame was fitting on it, it was nothing like the b,ack white and red picture, this was dull, beige, they were kidding me. I went right down stairs, no manager to be fond. The sweet girl, couldn't help me, manager wasn't come see or talk to me. Never came and cleaned my room all day , left me with no clean towels or shampoos, it was a disgusting mess and then to get the bill for 3 nights, 820 dollars, really, they lied to me, by over 200 dollars and no, I didn't mix up euros for dollars I had taken 12 years of French I knew the difference , they ripped me off. They, the management were cowards, never once making the time or effort to email me, contact me to try to resolve this, I tried to stop payment and they had my money , why wold they do the right thing. However, I will continue to post the truth and go to better business bureau until justice is done. People who are on vacation and explain situation, especially, when they are handicapped like myself should not be taken advantage of for a buck, shame on you. Do not stay here and support this hotel, there are plenty of other hotels in Paris ...

Reviews.Title: “Good location and stylish”
Reviews.Author: Temple1960
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel for which the positives are its location - a few minutes walk from Champs Elysees and the Seine - and the modern, stylish decorated bedroom and bathroom. Plenty of space in the bedroom and bed was very comfortable. There were friendly and helpful staff on reception who were happy to recommend local brasseries to eat in the evening. I was there on business and this was perfect for my requirements. Only downsides are relatively minor. There is no restaurant for evening meals, although clearly there are many places to go within a few minutes walk (though as I had a heavy cold on a freezing night in January so would rather have stayed in given the choice!). The breakfast is basic (fruit salad that tasted as if it had come from a tin, and uninspiring pastries), and served in a room that has more chairs than it can comfortably accommodate - so slightly too cramped if you arrive when busy. I also found the very modern tap arrangement in the bathroom too complex - couldn't find out how to control temperature! The shower temperature was tepid at best. However, all in all I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and price”
Reviews.Author: LindseyMac
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and a great price for the location. Easy walking distance to Champs Elysees, Arc du Triomphe, Eiffel Tower, and more! We hardly had to take the cab or the metro. The rooms are HUGE for Europe and even large by American standards. The decor is really modern. The hotel staff was very helpful to non-French speakers. I would stay here anytime I visted Paris. There is food nearby and the metro station is within walking distance. The hotel is small so you feel as though you get more specialized service instead of just being a number.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: DallasKKG
Reviews.Content: This is the most fantastic, affordable hotel near the Champs Elysees! My husband and I traveled from Germany to Austria, to Switzerland and ended here...at the Hotel Marceau Champs Elysees. It more than exceeded our expectations, with generous sized rooms, beautiful decor, breakfast, and close walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, Arc de Triumph, the Champs Elysees and many metro stops. One thing (person) that will set this hotel aside from others is Adonis. He works at the hotel and has the absolute best recommendations of how to navigate the city and where to eat. We really enjoyed talking to him and found that he made our Paris stay very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are deceiving. Noisey hotel, needs a remodel. Good location”
Reviews.Author: czech99
Reviews.Content: In Paris the following applies, you get what you pay for. The location is perfect. Literally 1 block away is a hotel that will cost your 4x as much, but theres a reason. When we arrived i was a bit dissapointed, because the pictures on the internet make it look a lot nicer. The lobby was decent. Rooms are small (big deal) but when you enter you can see that were was a very poor renovation/remodel done. Paint peeling off, not painted nicely. Seemed run down and not very well taken care off. This was probably our least favorite hotel of our entire 17 day trip to europe and also one of the most expensive hotels (thanks paris lol) Breakfast was included which at the time of checkin the guy tried to convince me otherwise. Staff was friendly, however one instance we came back to the hotel and the gf had held going to the restroom and was going to go when we got back, however the 1 gentlmen manning the frontdesk was helping someone, he completely ignored us for 5 minutes as we stood there waiting to get our key instead of just excusing himself for 5 seconds to ask which room we have and handing us the key, made us wait like we were strangers. Probably wouldnt have bugged me, but the fact that the gf had to use the restroom made it worse. Our room was extremely noisey. So cramped and small you could hear everything. We had some family next to use or above us (couldnt tell) with a little kid running around banging at 2am. I finally got so fed up and hit the walls and yelled SHUT UP. They still didnt quite down. Opened the window and let the "city noise" drown them out. After the first night that left a bad taste in our mouth for the rest of the stay there. Paris is awesome, but next time we'll just cough it up and pay extra and stay somewhere nicer. Like I said, if youre on a budget and want a great location, consider this place. 5-10min walk to the champs de elysee.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good all round!”
Reviews.Author: Steve S
Reviews.Content: Arrived late. The reception staff spoke good english and were helpful. The room was large (one of the largest on the 6th floor based upon the floor plan. The room was clean, the TV was good, the shower was good. Everything I needed for a one night stay. 2 very busy bars near by and a shop just two blocks up. The breakfast is very good with the obligatory amazing fresh french bread, eggs, sausage and ham, cereal and good coffee. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dawnyj47
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Overall, the hotel is very good and is in a nice location. We were able to walk to most attractions. We were able to check in early which was great. The rooms are very small but apparently this is to be expected in Paris. As the rooms are small and close to each other you can often hear what's going on in the other rooms. The windows however do keep the road noise to a minimum though. The rooms are very clean and were tended to every day. The breakfast was a little disappointing but was still adequate. I thought it was odd that there wasn't any ham or cheeses but sausage & bacon. The dining room is also quite small so be prepared to share a table for breakfast. The breakfast was included in the room rate which is an added bonus as Paris is so expensive. We booked direct with the hotel (as recommended by another reviewer) and actually got a cheaper deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: u425868
Reviews.Content: I saw this property first reviewed on TripAdvisor and booked it for 4 nights based on the positive reviews. I must say, we were not disappointed. Great breakfast helped us get started, friendly staff available 24/7, and a great location made this the perfect place for our trip. Cab fares were always between 10-20 Euros to most places of interest we visited (Louvre, Paris Nord Station for a trip to Brussels). The Eiffel Tower is within walking distance, so is the Champs Elysees. Cab fare from the airport was between 50-60 Euro in morning rush hour traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not good, but you are in PARIS!”
Reviews.Author: gardenerBloomington
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a few blocks off of the Champs Elysees and a few blocks in the other direction of the Seine. The hotel staff were very nice and speak english. The room was small and the TV did not work at all. It had a small refrigerator in the room and a nice sized bathroom with a tub. The only problem was that carpet was bunched up and dirty and the shower tile had mold on them and the corners of the bathroom floor were pretty dirty. Since I've stayed in some pretty disgusting hotels....this one was not really that bad. It was in a great location and who stays in their hotel that much while in Paris anyway? It was very quite, but I do not think that there was anyone in the other rooms until the last night and the walls were extremely thin and you would here them in the bathroom. We did have the breakfast one day and the eggs were extremely over cooked and turning green, but the pastries were fresh. Would I stay here again? Probably not. I'd find something cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Nada D
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, reception is so friendly and lovely. The location is great 10 minute walk to all the right places. The cost was good too for such a convenient location. I'd definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Medium”
Reviews.Author: Maya Z
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very good and the reception service was very good, however the wireless internet connection is not available in rooms, the furniture is old in the rooms. in addition, the rooms were not properly cleaned. We would come back on our next trip to Paris but the hotel has to improve the above, especially when it comes to wireless internet connection. thank you

Reviews.Title: “will come back again”
Reviews.Author: s c
Reviews.Content: I was in paris a few weeks ago and stayed in this hotel.great location!minutes to Eiffel tower,etoile, and other attractions,close to metro and RER.found the staff to be very friendly and helpful.room was small but very clean with modern bathroom.I will go back again.and LOVED PARIS:-)

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location!”
Reviews.Author: boo12
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my husband for 4 nights in July 11. I had searched and searched for hotels that were reasonably priced and after reading reviews on trip advisor decided to book Hotel Marceau. I initially booked via a third party but then found the rooms cheaper direct on the hotels website. We booked a deluxe room and were pleasantly surprised. the room was small but to be expected, and was functional and the finish and decor were great: obviously been newly decorated and was very clean. The staff were very friendly and keen to help. Breakfast was very 'continental', a few pastries and coffee, so don't expect a full english! but it did the job. The location of this hotel was the best thing, so easy to find, literally 5 mins walk from the Champs Elysee (and George V metro stop) and about 15 mins walk from the Eiffel tower. It is an expensive area but the hotel was reasonably priced and the area felt safe and well lit. There was a lovely bar just next door that we went in a couple of nights. All in all if you are going to Paris as a tourist and will be out sightseeing for most of the day then this hotel is perfect. Compared to a lot of prices in Paris this hotel is very reasonably priced! They have free wifi and will arrange transport for you.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible and Misleading”
Reviews.Author: Marwa_M
Reviews.Content: My husband and i were on a trip to Paris on June 2011. We booked at the Hotel Marceau given its close proximity to the CHamps. We were extremley disappointed. We booked a Deluxe Superior Room, but the room we got was nothing close to a superior room. We enquired with the receptionist and his reply was "this is the standard in Paris, you can't get any better, trust me". Now this is POOR customer service in my opinion. The pictures on their website were very misleading. and the room sizes were exceptionally small. My husband enquired with the receptionist if we can cancel the booking, and the receptionist initially said yes. Hence, my husband was googling alternative hotels within the same area. Fortunatley we found one. However, the receptionist decided to change his mind and tro to fool us by saying that we have to pay for the full duration that we have booked (which is of course not what is mentioned in the terms and conditions). After a long back and forth with my husband, the receptionist said ok we can pay for the one night only. It was a very horrible experience all in all and hope that we do not repeat it. I felt very unsafe, to the extent that i slept with all our money and passports undearneath my pillow! That's how unsafe i felt.

Reviews.Title: “Last night in Paris ...”
Reviews.Author: kitwatwestendr
Reviews.Content: Had a delightful stay in this hotel for our last night in Paris ... our room overlooked a small square just outside the hotel ... restaurant, tobacco shop, and press booth just outside the door ... the room was very nice with two windows each with a Juliette balcony (faux balcony) ... the bathroom was very modern and clean ... continental breakfast included ... staff very friendly and helpful ... they helped us obtain a dinner reservation at 58 Tour Eiffel which was the highlight of our trip to Paris ... the hotel is not far from the Champs Elysee and the drop off / pick up for Les Cars Air France ... would recommend this hotel for a stay in Paris ... Thank you to the staff on the front desk both day and night staff ... Thanks to Armand who made me fresh coffee with crosissant when I woke up early and went down for a smoke outside ... Regards, Andrew and Brad (Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location, Great Room.”
Reviews.Author: annilizzi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in November. It was wonderful! The hotel is great. Clean, good quality, and the room was a nice size, with a very comfortable bed. The staff was so-so, some nicer than others - one gentleman was VERY kind in helping us print something from the hotel's computer. They were also helpful in assisting us in navigating Paris. I believe the hotel has a restaurant on site (which we never ate at). The best part of this hotel is the location. It is within walking distance of some great sites, wonderful restaurants, and public transportation. My husband and I really like to walk - so we managed to walk ALL over Paris from this hotel. We also used the underground metro one or twice, and the metro stop is just blocks from the hotel. I'd highly recommend this hotel to other travelers. I felt like the majority of the guests were business travelers, which was actually kind of nice - the hotel was nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: natswest
Reviews.Content: went on a special holiday with my mom, we stayed in a fabulous hotel in London the Park Plaza Westminster. When we checked in Hotel Marceau we were horribly disappointed, the room was very small, and very basic, the bathroom tiny! the beds are definitely not single beds but smaller than that, so as twin beds i felt like noddy on the one. The breakfast very disappointing, not worth even being included in the rate. The position is good, but for 284euro there are better hotels. For 1 person the deluxe room would be fine, but for 2people its way too cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fernando0105
Reviews.Content: great hotel, very well located, friendly staff! good breakfast! the wifi works only for one equipment at a time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place”
Reviews.Author: Thess
Reviews.Content: I recently took a long weekend in Paris with my best friend, and booked Hotel Marceau after reading about it here on Tripadvisor. I like the location - it's a quiet part of Paris, but still with walking distance to most things. I had a booked a Deluxe room with two beds, and got one on the 6th floor. The room was a nice size, with pleasant decor, a nicely appointed but very small bathroom and comfortable beds. There were two things we liked less: Absolutely no closet-space to talk about!!! We were two women traveling together, and the only closet was a tiny one built-in under the slanted ceiling/roof. It wasn't even tall enough to hang an average length dress! I had to hang my dresses from the curtain-rail... The other thing was the abscence of adequate electrical outlets. Not a single one close to the bed! There was one over the desk by the window, and one by the door at the opposite end of the room. But with laptops, cameras and cellphones - it was a puzzle to get everything charged... Breakfast was good even if the selection was not very large! Staff at the frontdesk was very helpful with everything we needed and spoke excellent English! I would consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Both the hotel and rooms were VERY clean and modern. All the staff were very friendly. Excellent location all the major attracti”
Reviews.Author: Authrom
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel a little early, about 11am, was met by very friendly staff on the front desk. As we arrived early we had a short 10 min wait while our room was made ready. The room was small but not uncomfortable and very clean. The bathroom was immaculate with an excellent shower. Will definitely return and recommend the hotel to our friends and family

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE BOUTIQUE HOTEL !”
Reviews.Author: jennypgp2
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this hotel. I stayed at this hotel for four nights while on business in Paris. I arrived close to midnight and check-in was quick, friendly, and efficient. The Superior room was quiet, pleasant, and very comfortable. The hotel is just two blocks from the Champs Elysees and a short 20 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and to the Trocadero. After checking-out, I left my luggage for the day and returned later in the afternoon. I definitely will stay again at this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms and fantastic staff, I wouldnt hesitate to return.”
Reviews.Author: mammasuellanelli
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, newly decorated in a very modern and comfortable style. The staff, especially Adonis on the front desk are fantastic. They all speak English and are only too happy to advise, recommend and book taxis/restraunts/events. The hotel is situated not far from the Arc de Triumph and in walking distance of the Eiffel tower, palias de Congress and many wonderful cafes and posh restraunts in a very safe and pleasant area. It has a small breakfast room, serving a small selection of hot and cold refreshments but no bar or restraunt which is no issue as its situated near to so many local places. I wouldnt hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no complaints - had everyting we were looking for.”
Reviews.Author: Wilpshirerick
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews we were slightly anxious about our stay. Absolutely no reason to be - location is excellent - right in the heart of he Champs-Elysees area. Room was excellent - right, modern, tasteful and spotless. Breakfast has received some harsh criticism from other guests - I can only say it must have improved greatly - we were totally satisfied with what was on offer. Enjoyed a splendid long weekend - we have been to Paris many many times over the last 40 years - this hotel is as good as we've had.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms and extremely helpful staff in great location”
Reviews.Author: mumaus
Reviews.Content: The accommodation was excellent, with comfortable modern rooms and facilities. It was a very convenient location but it was made even better by the excellent work of the young lady in reception who was incredibly helpful with everything, right through to advising us on restaurants and making the resevations for us. The facilities were great but she was brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL IN PARIS !!!”
Reviews.Author: Elena00193
Reviews.Content: I spent a lomg time on Trip Advisor researching hotels in Paris and settled on this one. It was a great choice. We choose this hotel for this locatiom and because it seemed to be very nice. We did not get disapointed. The hotel was small ( 35 rooms ) but very nice and very close to the Champs Elysees and the Eiffel Tower. The room ( superior room ) was just lovely and perfect for our stay. We arrived before the check in time and were lucky enough that our room was ready so we were able to chec in. Staff was very friendly. There was a free Wifi access. The next day after check out as we were not living Paris untill 6 pm that night we were aload to leave our bags in the hotel so we could do some last minute shopping. We will definitely come back and stay next time will come in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: nunutzi
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice, comfortable and well located. When we stayed the elevator didn't work and we needed to go up 6 floors, but apart from that it was great. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: oasishair62
Reviews.Content: Very cute hotel. Staff was very helpful and some spoke English. Location was great in that it was close to many sights or transit. Found the rooms to be a little small in comparison to all I've stayed at in Canada, but was still clean and very comfortable. Was not use to not having a lounge in a hotel of this calabre, but I guess is typical for European hotels. Airconditioning in the rooms work well but they blow onto your face when in bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Strict Front Desk, Don't Book Classic Room”
Reviews.Author: CanadianTraveller161
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Marceau Champs Elysees in June 2010 for a total of 3 nights. The Hotel is in a wonderful location in Paris. Within walking distance of just about everything! A few days before we arrived we discovered that one more person was joining us for the first night and we therefore upgraded our room from a 2 bedroom to a 3 bedroom. The Hotel was very accommodating considering the last minute change of plans. The triple room happened to be a "Deluxe Room" which was VERY nice and modern. Coming from North America it is comparable to a room you would get a 4 or 5 star hotel. However the remaining 2 nights we switched to a "Classic Room" which we regretted. They don't show pictures of this room on the website for a reason. They Classic Room hasn't been renovated since probably 1970 and is extremely small. I highly recommend paying the 30 Euros for a Superior or Deluxe Room, it will make or break your experience. Also, the front desk is very strict about guests, we had friends in the area and they were not very fond of them coming up to our rooms. Overall: Good Hotel aslong as you book the right room! It was also very clean by the way

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, that's about all we can say”
Reviews.Author: di29di
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 5 nights based on everything we read in reviews and their website "Renovated this year, we invite you to discover its 35 rooms, all decorated in a unique and very original style" and other travel sites. We booked a classic room but found it musty, unrenovated, an old bed and a terrible bathroom so we upgraded to s superior room for an extra 30E/night. The design of the bathroom allowed the water to come out of the shower stall so we had to put towels down to prevent the water from going into the bedroom. The shower head is placed in front of the tap so you get soaked with cold water when turning it on. They are very cheap with their towels and toiletries. There are no drawers to put you clothes into. They advertise safes in the room but in fact only are in the superior or deluxe room. You have to give them your room key when you leave and have to wait for the receptionist to get it back. One of the reading lights in ourroom was broken and they could not fix it. There are only 2 English speaking channels-CNN and BBC. The hotel owner told us there were many English channels when we checked in. Be sure to bring books to read if that is your only language. There was a woman receptionist that was most helpful, the men had attitiute and could barely speak English enough to be helpful. The walls are paper thin. You can hear connversation and the opening and closing of your neighbours doors at all hours of the day and night. The good things: It is very close to the bus stop (#72) to take you to The Louvre and the Left Bank. It is a very close walk to the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triumph. the walk to the Metro is far if you want to go to the Left bank. However the walk to the Metro for Versaille is close. There is a grocery store around the corner and a fantastic bakery called Midori-fabulous bread, flan, cheesecake and more. A choclatier making chocolates in the window as well. On Wednesdy and Saturday there is an open Market on the boulevard at the end of the street. I would recommend this hotel for location to the Champs Elysee , the Eiffel and the Arc and if you are upgrading. If you want to be where the action is stay near the Left Bank, but be very careful on hotel selection, a min of 4 *'s.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Hotel”
Reviews.Author: D777799
Reviews.Content: I have Stayed in many hotels in the world be it 5 star to a 1 star.But i might say this lil Gem of a hotel is got a very good service in France.As you know French and their Attitude , this hotel is perfect .The service is good .Breakfast could be better.Try and get the deluxe or the superiour.The classis is really small. It;s walking distance from all the major attractions : Effiel Tower 20 mins .The Arc 20 Mins, The louvre Muesuem is 30 Mins. The Famous Champs Eleyeses is only 5 mins away .So if your in a fix budget and you want good service this is Ideal . Trust me on This one. Mr Emad is the perfect guy in the hotel , he would go out of his way to help anyone satying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very central for tourist”
Reviews.Author: ajjcummins
Reviews.Content: just back from paris and stayed here on our last night after coming in from versailles. we had no booking made so just went in and enquired about rates in a few hotels in the area. we got this hotel for 150 euros b & b and were able to check in straight away. it was a good bit cheaper than other hotels in the area. the hotel is very clean, its just been revamped and our room was on the 5th floor with access to little balcony . the room was a bit small but nice bathroom and certainly very comfortable. the location was excellent for touring paris..... easy walk to arc de triomphe and champs elysee and the alma marceau metro station only 5 mins away.... eiffel tower also not too far away.... breakfast was also reasonable .... coffee, croissants, bread and cereal.. this hotel is a great base to explore paris from, there are also good variety of bars and restaurants nearby and a small supermarket about 100 meters away. also alot of parking in paris is free in august so i was able to park right outside the door for free.

Reviews.Title: “THE perfect hotel to stay at in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: BrizzieMum
Reviews.Content: This modern hotel is perfectly positioned close to everything you'll need. The super friendly, helpful staff will happily assist you with all your needs. Very clean, comfortable rooms. Hot and cold buffet breakfast, bacon, scrambled eggs, pastries, cereal, yoghurts etc Highly recommend as the perfect place to stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cathy-Gorman
Reviews.Content: Staff very welcoming and helpful, room was clean & neat, centrally located, 5 min easy walk to the Arc de Triomphe, 15 to the Tour de Effiel, closer to metros, found a very reasonable 'grocery/liquor' shop maybe 1-2 blocks away, very convenient location. Our 1st trip to Europe/Paris and it was a good one. We would recommend to our friends. Well worth the extra euros for our short stay (3 nights).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing after a day's work”
Reviews.Author: Hernanlo
Reviews.Content: Small but nice clean room, very nice and trendy bathroom

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ophelieR
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in this beautiful domestic Parisian hotel; we then joined our friends (French). We have been welcomed by Aurelie, helpful and charming women. The hotel is situated on a beautiful and fine avenue, right by the Champs Elysées. We went to the Eiffel tower by foot.( You should be prepared for one hour queue !) Sweet rooms, though a bit small. We really enjoyed our stay, thank-you very much!

Reviews.Title: “LIARS - do not trust this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JMacL0nd0n
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms for a weekend in Paris with friends through the Amex Travel Service. When we arrived to check in we were told the hotel had been overbooked and we were moved to a far inferior hotel. The service in this hotel when we learnt of their mistake was unbelieveable, they did not care about the mistake and offered us no level of customer service. The gentleman who arrived after us was not even offered an alternative hotel he was just told the hotel was overbooked. Do not trust this hotel, in my opinion they are just out to make a quick buck and are quickly earning themselves a reputation for doing so!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dodke
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant boutique hotel near the Arc de Triomphe. Rooms are not very large (this is Paris) but tastefully decorated. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising standard”
Reviews.Author: sg44Oslo
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by the quality of the hotel provided the number of stars. Rooms are not too big, but feature what is needed on a business trip including a good quality network free of charge. Rooms are recently refurbished and provides a good first impression. The location is superb with short distances to most meeting locations and still situated in a quiet area which provides good sleep. The front desk is operated by very helpful people.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory, but very average”
Reviews.Author: 100nights
Reviews.Content: Well located. Enthusiastic welcome and efficient service throughout. The room decor was a little tired and the facilities very average, nothing special and only average value for money. Free internet was appreciated as it can be irritating to pay stupid money for what is now a generic service One would do better to spend the same, but stay a little further out.

Reviews.Title: “Their online pictures are deceiving....”
Reviews.Author: faby99
Reviews.Content: I usually like to give everyone the benefit of the doubt when it comes to customer service since I've worked in this industry for 12+ years. I booked a room with 2 twin beds, already expecting a small room, typical of European hotel rooms. The hotel is very modern looking online, in their brochures and even the lobby, once we walked into our room, it was like walking into a 1970's hotel room, no where like the pictures they advertised. Once I called the front desk to inquire about our room and possibly moving rooms, the front desk gentleman told me I had to call back the next day and speak to his female counterpart that would be able to help me???? Was he not capable of answering my questions??? The next day I spoke to his female counterpart and she informed me that the room I had reserved was the basic room, not the deluxe rooms which were the ones that were modern and looked like the pictures. Interesting fact, at breakfast in the hotel when we started to ask other guests about their stay, they all commented that they enjoyed their rooms with all the modern commodities???? Needless to say we paid for the upgrade, after this everything was good. Definitely a great location!!!!!! and the front desk lady was very helpful and friendly for the remainder of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “hygienic and Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mani_goswami
Reviews.Content: I liked the room, it was clean and hygienic. I also liked the breakfast served. Except the false fire alarm which went off once and disturbed my sleep, every thing was good.

Reviews.Title: “Our official dating hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chibiroo
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, a little bit to the left is Arc d Triomphe, a little bit to the right is the Eiffel. Funny, creative, helpful, friendly staff. Homely breakfast. Very clean, petite rooms. Some guests made noise in the corridors, you could hear every curse they uttered,it was understandable as it was New Year's eve. We are salary earners in Europe and always go on budget, we have declared Paris our official dating city and Hotel Marceau Champs Elysees our official dating hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Marceau Champs Elysees
HotelInfo.Address: 37, avenue Marceau, 75116 Paris, France
